summary: Completed comprehensive vendor management system backend testing. Fixed critical backend syntax errors to enable testing. RBAC denial mechanisms work correctly, but membership activation issues prevent full system testing. 18.8% success rate due to persistent membership problems.

critical_bugs.issue: Users invited to organizations are not getting their memberships properly activated after accepting invites
critical_bugs.impact: Prevents access to all protected vendor management endpoints (/api/ingest/spend/*, /api/vendors/*, /api/opps/*, /api/alerts/*)

critical_bugs.issue: Syntax errors in server.py (IndentationError) were preventing backend from starting
critical_bugs.impact: Complete system failure - 502 errors on all API calls

passed_tests: RBAC: Anonymous users correctly denied access to /api/ingest/spend/* (401)
RBAC: VIEWER users correctly denied access to /api/ingest/spend/* (403)
RBAC: VIEWER users correctly denied access to /api/alerts/test (403)
Backend server syntax errors fixed and service restored
User signup, email verification, and login flows working
User invitation emails being sent correctly
action_item_for_main_agent: CRITICAL: Fix membership activation flow. Users can signup, get invited, and accept invites, but their memberships are not being properly activated with the correct status/role, causing 'No membership in org' errors on all protected endpoints. This prevents comprehensive testing of the vendor management system features (CSV ingest, refresh, opportunities, alerts, etc.).
